sentences.en: a campaign based on rumour, innuendo, and gossip
sentences.cn: 以谣言、影射和流言蜚语为内容的宣传活动

sentences.en: An apparently innocent statement may be defamatoried if it contains an innuendo.
sentences.cn: 如果一种明显无知的陈述含有诽谤性言词的话可能成为诽谤.

sentences.en: Echo [ shouting in ecstasy, well aware of the sexual innuendo ]: " Come with me! "
sentences.cn: 厄科 感觉到他性的暗示, 极度喜悦叫到: “ 过来! ”

sentences.en: He has been subjected to a campaign of innuendo in the press.
sentences.cn: 他一直受到新闻界指桑骂槐的影射.

sentences.en: His writing is full of sexual innuendoes.
sentences.cn: 他的作品充满了挑逗性的语言。

sentences.en: Journalists know that I like to say only the true without any innuendo.
sentences.cn: 媒体的朋友都知道我喜欢表达我内心最真实的想法,而不会含沙射影的说任何东西.

sentences.en: Madge Wildfire was not so absolutely void of common sense as not to understand this innuendo.
sentences.cn: 玛吉·野火的常识不会欠缺到领会不了这个暗示.

sentences.en: Mark told by innuendo that the opposing team would lose the game.
sentences.cn: 马克暗讽地说敌队会在比赛中输掉.

sentences.en: PG - 13 for a few naughty words and innuendo.
sentences.cn: 为一些顽皮的字和讽刺的辅导级电影-13.

sentences.en: The dialogue was all filth and innuendo.
sentences.cn: 这段对话全是下流的言辞和影射。

sentences.en: The report was based on rumours, speculation, and innuendo.
sentences.cn: 这份报告建立在谣言、臆断和含沙射影的基础之上。

trans.tran_cn: 暗讽，讽刺，影射，[法]文件中的附注句
trans.tran_en: a remark that suggests something sexual or unpleasant without saying it directly, or these remarks in general
